metadata.title: CVE-2014-125025 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability classified as problematic has been found in FFmpeg 2.0.This affects the function decode_pulses. The manipulation leads to memorycorruption. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. It isrecommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
